page.title: 04 Knole House
page.content: 5 Children from our class went to visit Knole House to gather information. Knole House is a very old building in Sevenoaks. It was built hundreds of years ago in 1456. It was bought from Baron Say and Sele by Archbishop Bourchier for 266 pounds, 13 shillings and 4 pence in old money. We found out that they have 1000 acres of land and between 300 and 400 deer. Everytime a tree falls down they plant a new one. They haven't had any burglaries, their most treasured possessions are King Charles' bed, his silver and his furniture. Eighty eight and a half thousand tourists visit the house per year and they have 25 cottages for all the old workers. We enjoyed our visit very much.
